docs.lead_paragraph: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in some Republican-controlled states want to end public funding for Planned Parenthood or to investigate it in response to videos claiming that it profits from fetal tissue sales.

headline.main: States Move to Cut Funds for Planned Parenthood
headline.print_headline: States Move to Cut Funds for Provider of Abortions

docs.abstract: Anti-abortion officials in many Republican-controlled states are attempting to block public funding for Planned Parenthood, or to mount investigations into organization; efforts are reaction to controversial video footage of Planned Parenthood officials discussing fetal tissue.
docs.snippet: Officials in some Republican-controlled states want to end public funding for Planned Parenthood or to investigate it in response to videos claiming that it profits from fetal tissue sales.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York City Department of Investigation has rebuked a report submitted by the Department of Education that also recommended the firing of the therapist, Debra Fisher.

headline.main: Major Flaws Found in Inquiry That Led to Suspension of Public-School Therapist
headline.print_headline: Bureaucratic Missteps at Many Turns in an Education Dept. Inquiry

docs.abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines absurdities of case against Debra Fisher, devoted occupational therapist in New York City school system who was suspended without pay in 2014 for conflicts of interest and theft of services; observes that charges are fruit of dysfunctional bureaucracy in Education Dept; notes Fisher's suspension and procedures that brought charges against her are under review.
docs.snippet: The New York City Department of Investigation has rebuked a report submitted by the Department of Education that also recommended the firing of the therapist, Debra Fisher.

docs.lead_paragraph: Remove the bluster, and the main way Mr. Trump stands out on economic and social policy is being to the left of the rest of the G.O.P. field.

headline.print_headline: The Case for Trump as a Moderate Republican

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Donald J Trump, beneath his blunt, sometimes pugnacious and rude comments, is actually moderate Republican; his occasional, substantive statements concerning public policy are attracting many voters.
docs.snippet: Remove the bluster, and the main way Mr. Trump stands out on economic and social policy is being to the left of the rest of the G.O.P. field.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of residents displaced by huge explosions last week in the Chinese port of Tianjin demanded compensation on Monday, as authorities worked to complete a sweep of the blast site for dangerous chemicals.

headline.main: Protesters Demand Compensation for China Blasts Amid Chemical Clean-Up
headline.print_headline: Protesters Demand Compensation for China Blasts Amid Chemical Clean-Up

docs.snippet: Hundreds of residents displaced by huge explosions last week in the Chinese port of Tianjin demanded compensation on Monday, as authorities worked to complete a sweep of the blast site for dangerous chemicals.

docs.lead_paragraph: As more farms open themselves up to visitors for apple picking, hay rides and some extra income, experts are advising owners to take steps to prevent accidents — be they small or fatal.

headline.main: Agritourism Growth Sparks Concerns Over Safety, Liability
headline.print_headline: Agritourism Growth Sparks Concerns Over Safety, Liability

docs.snippet: As more farms open themselves up to visitors for apple picking, hay rides and some extra income, experts are advising owners to take steps to prevent accidents — be they small or fatal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Social Security pushes people to take early retirement. It’s perverse.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Laurence J Kotlikoff and Robert C Pozen examines ways Social Security acts as disincentive to work past age of 62 for many Americans; points to oddity of adjustment for reduction factor, which many people do not understand, and suggests incentivizing Americans to work until they are older.
docs.snippet: Social Security pushes people to take early retirement. It’s perverse.

byline.original: By LAURENCE J. KOTLIKOFF and ROBERT C. POZEN

docs.lead_paragraph: Most of the insurance co-ops created under the Affordable Care Act enrolled fewer people than they had predicted, according to the inspector general at the health department.

headline.main: Most Health Insurance Co-ops Are Losing Money, Federal Audit Finds
headline.print_headline: Insurance Co-ops Are Losing Money, Federal Audit Finds

docs.abstract: Government audit finds that 22 out of the 23 federal health insurance co-ops created under Affordable Care Act are losing money and may have difficulty repaying federal loans; finding, from Health and Human Services Dept, spurs Obama administration to increase supervision of carriers through process it is calling 'enhanced oversight.'
docs.snippet: Most of the insurance co-ops created under the Affordable Care Act enrolled fewer people than they had predicted, according to the inspector general at the health department.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts say to prioritize, estimate all the costs and try to use loyalty programs and last-minute bargains.

headline.print_headline: Some Money-Saving Tips for Older Americans Yearning to Hit the Road

docs.abstract: Ideas from experts given on how older Americans can save money in their leisure travels.
docs.snippet: Experts say to prioritize, estimate all the costs and try to use loyalty programs and last-minute bargains.
